docs.snippet: FIFA's disciplinary committee chairman says Luis Suarez received a just punishment and was not made an example of.

docs.snippet: The Netherlands start as firm favourites for their World Cup quarter-final against Costa Rica on Saturday but will take nothing for granted when they meet the tournament’s surprise package, who have already seen off three former world...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Netherlands start as firm favourites for their World Cup quarter-final against Costa Rica on Saturday but will take nothing for granted when they meet the tournament’s surprise package, who have already seen off three former world champions.

headline.main: Dutch Determined to Avoid Costa Rica Shock

docs.snippet: In 25 attempts, Colombia has only beaten Brazil twice, and never managed it on Brazilian soil.
docs.lead_paragraph: In 25 attempts, Colombia has only beaten Brazil twice, and never managed it on Brazilian soil.

docs.snippet: The tournament has not produced the disasters some feared, and many Brazilians who were angry about lavish spending on the event cannot help getting caught up in its spirit.
docs.lead_paragraph: The tournament has not produced the disasters some feared, and many Brazilians who were angry about lavish spending on the event cannot help getting caught up in its spirit.
docs.abstract: Survey conducted by Brazilian research company Datafolha finds that Brazilians are softening in their views of the World Cup, buoyed by series of stunning matches and lack of major problems in hosting of the tournament.

headline.main: Brazil Comes Around as the World Cup Plays On
headline.print_headline: Brazil Comes Around as the Cup Plays On

byline.contributor: Mariana Simões contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro, and Seth Kugel from Salvador, Brazil.

docs.snippet: Germany advanced to its 16th straight quarterfinals, but not before getting an almighty scare from minnows Algeria. Its defense, in particular, looked shaky, which will not do against Karim Benzema, Mathieu Valbuena, Paul Pogba and France’s potent...
docs.abstract: Germany advanced to its 16th straight quarterfinals, but not before getting an almighty scare from minnows Algeria. Its defense, in particular, looked shaky, which will not do against Karim Benzema, Mathieu Valbuena, Paul Pogba and France’s potent attack, which has 10 goals in four games.

headline.main: France vs. Germany: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
